experience.description: PRAS is an autonomous service robotic platform. Its social and assistive design is intended for hospital environments and nursing homes, facilitating interaction and support for patients and healthcare staff through advanced and secure technology.

slide1.title: What is PRAS?
slide1.subtitle: Advanced technology in real use
slide1.description1: PRAS is a mobile robotic platform designed for hospital environments. It currently has a functional version (TRL-7) capable of delivering medications through a robotic arm and taking patients' temperature with RGB and thermal cameras.
slide1.description2: It integrates ChatOS, a voice or text control system through a mobile app, facilitating interaction with healthcare staff. It was presented at MWC Shanghai 2023.

slide2.title: PRAS Competitive Advantages
slide2.description1: PRAS offers a low-cost robotic solution, much more affordable than other platforms (>30,000 USD). Its modular design allows adaptations and updates without replacing the entire equipment.
slide2.description2: It features an unlimited battery system, based on dual interchangeable batteries, avoiding downtime. Additionally, it allows simultaneous interaction from multiple interfaces.

slide3.title: Vision
slide3.description1: PRAS relies on optimized design, manufacturing with standard components and 3D printing.
slide3.description2: Its ROS-based software allows flexible customization and cost reduction. It is projected as an accessible solution for the growing global cobot market.
slide3.description3: It is projected as an accessible solution for the growing global cobot market.

items: Drastically lower cost compared to other platforms.
Focused on making robotics viable for SMEs and healthcare centers with tight budgets.

items: Allows adding, replacing, or updating components without changing the entire unit.

items: Operates continuously thanks to a dual battery system with automatic switching.

Fluid communication between staff and robot (text, voice, mobile, etc.).

design.title: Design
design.description1: Its elegant design is intuitive and combines
design.description3: PRAS can be modulated into various prototypes depending on the work it needs to perform.

design_carousel.01: PRAS Botlite is an autonomous robotic platform designed to move precisely in indoor environments. It moves using two drive wheels and a differential traction architecture, allowing it to turn on itself and navigate narrow spaces with agility. It is equipped with sensors such as LiDAR, cameras and an inertial measurement unit (IMU) that allow it to build a map of the environment, detect obstacles and move intelligently. Its structure is robust and customizable, making it the ideal starting point for educational, industrial or research applications.
design_carousel.02: By adding a collaborative robotic arm to the base, PRAS Botlite acquires the ability to physically interact with its environment. This configuration allows the robot not only to move around, but also to perform actions such as grabbing objects, placing them in different locations or pressing buttons, among many other tasks. Combined with its RGB-D camera, the system can detect and locate objects in 3D, track movements, identify points of interest and adjust arm movement in real time. This enables complex tasks such as vision-assisted pick and place, AI-guided manipulation or interaction with environmental elements without human intervention. All of this can be programmed and controlled through an intuitive interface, designed even for users without technical knowledge.
design_carousel.03: With the incorporation of a humanoid torso, PRAS Botlite transforms into a social robot, capable of expressing itself and communicating with people. The humanoid module features a mobile head, a screen that displays facial expressions and articulated arms that allow it to accompany its messages with gestures. Thanks to its voice system and natural language understanding, it can maintain simple conversations, answer questions or guide users in an interactive experience. This version is ideal for demonstrations, public attention, education or environments where communication between humans and robots is key.
design_carousel.04: In its telepresence version, PRAS Botlite incorporates a large format screen and a two-way audio system, allowing a person to connect remotely and move through a physical space as if they were there. This configuration turns the robot into a mobile avatar, ideal for meetings, guided tours, remote assistance or event participation without the need to be physically present. The user can control the robot's direction from anywhere in the world and communicate in real time through video and audio, while the platform handles smooth and safe navigation thanks to its sensors and autonomous capabilities. An effective and versatile solution to break down geographical barriers.

problems.title: Problems
list: Cardiac arrhythmias affect 10%-20% of the population and cause 15% of strokes in adults.
Current interventions (catheter ablation) are invasive, expensive, prolonged and require highly qualified specialists.

solution.title: Solution
list: Non-invasive system that combines an IoT suit, electronics and software with 3D, 360º visualization and AI.
Offers faster, safer and more accurate diagnosis without the need for invasive surgeries or catheters.

Precise visualization of electrical activity in 3D holographic.

clinical.title: In clinical practice

about.title: Who are we?
about.content:
Spika Tech is a technology company that illuminates the path of tomorrow by applying deep tech to solve real challenges with direct impact on people and organizations.

We are leaders in applied innovation, leading digital transformation with a team composed of doctors and engineers experts in:
• Artificial Intelligence
• Autonomous systems  
• Extended reality (VR/AR)

Committed to excellence and real impact, we use emerging technologies to generate positive impact in society.

**Our mission**: We apply deep tech to solve real challenges with direct impact on people and organizations.

**Our values**: Innovation, experience, people and excellence.

projects.title: Our projects
projects.content:
We have three main projects that demonstrate our expertise in emerging technologies:

1. **VR-CARDIO**: Platform for planning and intraoperative guidance of cardiac arrhythmia interventions using Virtual Reality. This project has received medical device validation from AEMPS.

2. **PRAS**: Robotic Platform for Healthcare Assistance. Social and assistive robot for hospital environments and senior residences, designed to improve patients' quality of life.

3. **First World Tour**: Immersive 3D, Virtual Reality and Augmented Reality exhibition that tells the epic story of Magellan and Elcano's first world tour, combining education and entertainment.

Each project reflects our commitment to applied innovation and positive social impact.
